name: Find & Replace Values

config.code:
import re from traceback import format_exc from typing import List def rossum_hook_request_handler(payload: dict) -> dict: """ The rossum_hook_request_handler is an obligatory main function that accepts input and produces output of the rossum custom function hook. :param payload: see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-data-format :return: messages and operations that update the annotation content or show messages """ messages = [] operations = [] if payload["event"] == "annotation_content" and ( payload["action"] in ["initialize", "user_update", "updated", "started"] ): try: messages, operations = main(payload) except Exception as e: messages = [ create_message( "error", "Serverless Function: " + str(e) + "
" + format_exc().replace("\n", "
"), ) ] return {"messages": messages} return {"messages": messages, "operations": operations} def main(payload: dict) -> dict: """ Main function describes the desired string formatting using regex. :param payload: see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-data-format :return: messages and operations that update the defined target fields """ global op_stack op_stack = [] operations = [] messages = [] condition_datapoints = [] schema_content = payload["schemas"][0]["content"] # Loop over configured actions for action in payload["settings"]["actions"]: # Check if manual overwrite of target datapoint is allowed - if not, the value will be recalculated target_user_update_trigger = False if action.get("allow_target_update") is True else True additional_user_update_datapoints = replace_datapoint_value( get_additional_user_update_datapoints( payload["annotation"]["content"], action.get("additional_user_update_trigger") ) ) if evaluate_queue_condition(action, payload): # Get condition datapoint by schema_id if action.get("action_condition"): msg, condition_datapoints = extract_schema_ids_from_condition( action["action_condition"], payload["annotation"]["content"], schema_content ) # Display warning in case action condition is defined on multiple tables with different sizes if msg: messages.append(msg[0]) continue # Loop over source and target field pairs defined in the action settings for source_target_mapping in action["source_target_mappings"]: source_fields = replace_datapoint_value( find_by_schema_id(payload["annotation"]["content"], source_target_mapping["source"]) ) if not find_by_value(schema_content, source_target_mapping["source"], "id"): messages.append( create_message( "warning", "Extension Value Transformations - Source field schema_id " + source_target_mapping["source"] + " not defined in the schema.", None, ) ) break target_fields = replace_datapoint_value( get_target_fields(payload, source_target_mapping["target"], source_fields) ) if not find_by_value(schema_content, source_target_mapping["target"], "id"): messages.append( create_message( "warning", "Extension Value Transformations - Target field schema_id " + source_target_mapping["target"] + " not defined in the schema.", None, ) ) break # More source fields than target fields is not allowed if len(source_fields) > len(target_fields): messages.append( create_message( "warning", "Extension Value Transformations - it is not allowed to map more source fields into lesser number of target fields.", None, ) ) break # Loop over datapoints for the particular source field elif (len(source_fields) == 1 and len(target_fields) >= 1) or ( len(source_fields) == len(target_fields) ): # Create pairs of source - target datapoints to iterate over source_target_pairs = generate_dp_pairs(source_fields, target_fields) # Check if action condition is not defined on LI level while target field is on header level if condition_datapoints: if len(target_fields) < len(condition_datapoints[0]): messages.append( create_message( "warning", "Extension Value Transformations - action condition is defined on Line Item level while target field on header level.", None, ) ) break # Will increase later if there's any condition, otherwise set to 0 by default index_condition_dp = -1 if condition_datapoints else 0 # Keep track of index of (target) field if condition is performed also on LI level for source_field, target_field in source_target_pairs: if condition_datapoints and len(condition_datapoints[0]) == len(target_fields): index_condition_dp += 1 elif condition_datapoints and len(condition_datapoints[0]) == 1: index_condition_dp = 0 # Evaluate annotation action and updated datapoints if evaluate_annotation_action_condition( payload, target_user_update_trigger, condition_datapoints, additional_user_update_datapoints, index_condition_dp, target_field, source_field, ): # Evaluate action condition on the lowest level (condition could be on line items) if not condition_datapoints or evaluate_action_condition( action, condition_datapoints, index_condition_dp ): value = apply_transformations( action["transformations"], source_field["content"]["value"] ) append_operation_to_stack(target_field["id"], value) # operations.append(create_replace_operation(target_field, value)) operations.extend(convert_op_stack_to_operations()) return messages, operations def get_additional_user_update_datapoints(content: dict, schema_ids: List) -> List: """ Returns list of datapoints referenced in additional_user_update_trigger property :param content: annotation content :schema_ids: List of schema IDs :return: List of found datapoints """ datapoints = [] if schema_ids: for schema_id in schema_ids: datapoints.extend(find_by_schema_id(content, schema_id)) return datapoints def convert_op_stack_to_operations() -> List: """ Converts op_stack to hook operations response format :return: List of operations """ operations = [] for op in op_stack: operations.append(create_replace_operation(op, op["content"]["value"])) return operations def append_operation_to_stack(datapoint_id: int, value: str) -> List: """ Formats datapoint id and value in the shape of datapoint and appends it to the operation stack :param op_stack: List of datapoints :param datapoint_id: id of the datapoint whose value was updated :param value: new value of the datapoint :return: List of updated datapoints """ already_present = False for op in op_stack: if op["id"] == datapoint_id: op["content"]["value"] = value already_present = True break if not already_present: op_stack.append({"id": datapoint_id, "content": {"value": value}}) def replace_datapoint_value(datapoints: List) -> List: """ Replaces value of a datapoint if its already in the op_stack array :param datapoints: List of datapoints to be compared with op_stack """ if datapoints: for dp in datapoints: for op in op_stack: if dp["id"] == op["id"]: dp["content"]["value"] = op["content"]["value"] return datapoints def evaluate_annotation_action_condition( payload: dict, user_update_trigger: bool, condition_datapoints: dict, additional_user_update_datapoints: dict, index_condition_dp: int, target_field: dict, source_field: dict, ) -> bool: """ Evaluates if annotation action and updated datapoints are met :param payload: hook payload :param user_update_trigger: a flag controlling if user updates trigger the action :param condition_datapoints: set of datapoints related to the action condition :param index_condition_dp: an index of a condition_datapoint - current context :param target_field: target field datapoint :param source_field: source field datapoint :return: Bool whether the condition evalues to true or false """ if payload["action"] == "initialize" or ( payload["updated_datapoints"] and ( (condition_datapoint_updated(condition_datapoints, payload["updated_datapoints"], index_condition_dp)) or (user_update_trigger and target_field["id"] in payload["updated_datapoints"]) or source_field["id"] in payload["updated_datapoints"] or (additional_datapoint_updated(additional_user_update_datapoints, payload["updated_datapoints"])) ) ): return True else: return False def generate_dp_pairs(smaller_set: dict, larger_set: dict) -> dict: """ Makes 2 arrays of different sized equal size - increases size of the smaller_set with initial len==1 to match len(larger_set) :param smaller_set: set to be enlarged - must be of size 1 initially :param larger_set: set to be matched by size :return: List of datapoint pairs """ pairs = [] for idx, t_field in enumerate(larger_set): if len(smaller_set) == len(larger_set): pairs.append((smaller_set[idx], t_field)) else: pairs.append((smaller_set[0], t_field)) return pairs def additional_datapoint_updated(additional_datapoints: dict, updated_datapoints: dict) -> bool: if additional_datapoints: for adp in additional_datapoints: if adp["id"] in updated_datapoints: return True return False def condition_datapoint_updated(condition_datapoints: dict, updated_datapoints: dict, index: int) -> bool: """ Checks if one of the datapoints referenced in action condition was modifed and should trigger the function :param condition_datapoints: action condition datapoints (array of arrays) :param updated_datapoints: list of updated datapoints' IDs :return: bool true if the updated datapoint is referenced in the action condition """ for cdp in condition_datapoints: if cdp[index]["id"] in updated_datapoints: return True return False def extract_schema_ids_from_condition(action_condition: str, content: dict, schema_content: dict) -> dict: """ Finds {schema_id} fields in the condition string and gets their datapoint from annotation content :param action_condition: action condition string :param content: annotation content :param schema_content : definition of the schema :return: dictionary of found datapoints """ messages = [] condition_datapoints = [] final_set = [] largest_set = 0 schema_ids = re.findall(r"({(.*?)})", action_condition) for schema_id in schema_ids: datapoints = replace_datapoint_value(find_by_schema_id(content, schema_id[1])) if datapoints: condition_datapoints.append(datapoints) if len(datapoints) > largest_set: largest_set = len(datapoints) if len(datapoints) > 1 and len(datapoints) != largest_set: messages.append( create_message( "warning", "Extension Value Transformations - It is not allowed to define action condition on multiple tables with different sizes.", ) ) else: if not find_by_value(schema_content, schema_id[1], "id"): messages.append( create_message( "warning", f"Extension Value Transformations - Schema_id {schema_id[1]} not defined in the schema.", ) ) for datapoints in condition_datapoints: if len(datapoints) < largest_set: for _idx in range(largest_set - 1): datapoints.append(datapoints[0]) final_set.append(datapoints) return messages, condition_datapoints def create_replace_operation(datapoint, new_value): """ Create and operation to replace the value of the datapoint with a new value. :param datapoint: content of the datapoint :param new_value: new value of the datapoint :return: dict with replace operation definition (see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-response-format) """ return { "op": "replace", "id": datapoint["id"], "value": { "content": { "value": new_value, } }, } def get_target_fields(payload: dict, target_field_schema_id: str, source_fields: List[dict]) -> List[dict]: """ Returns list of target fields. All datapoints with the defined target_field_schema_id are returned. When the target_field_schema_id is None the list of source fields is returned. :param payload: see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-data-format :param target_field_schema_id: schema id of the target field :param source_fields: list of source fields datapoints :return: list of target fields datapoints """ if not target_field_schema_id: return source_fields else: return find_by_schema_id(payload["annotation"]["content"], target_field_schema_id) def apply_transformations(transformations: List[dict], value: str) -> str: """ Transforms value using defined list of transformations. Each transformation is applied to the result of the previous one in the list. :param transformations: list of transformations with regular expressions defined in the settings :param value: string to be transformed :return: transformed string """ for transformation in transformations: if check_transformation_condition(transformation, value): value = transform_value(transformation, value) return value def transform_value(transformation: dict, value: str) -> str: """ Transforms value using defined regular expression. :param transformation: definition of the transformation that contains regular expression to identify a pattern in the string and a value by which the identified pattern is replaced. :param transformation: definition of the transformation :param value: string to be transformed :return: transformed string """ return re.sub( transformation["pattern_to_replace"], transformation["value_to_replace_with"], value, ) def check_transformation_condition(transformation: dict, value: str) -> bool: """ Verifies if the condition for particular transformation is matched. The condition is based on the searching of hte pattern defined by regular expression in the string. :param transformation: definition of the transformation containing the condition regular expression :param value: string to be checked :return: result of the conditions check (True of False) """ if "replace_if_this_pattern_matches" in transformation: return re.search(transformation["replace_if_this_pattern_matches"], value) else: return True def evaluate_queue_condition(action: dict, payload: dict) -> bool: """ Verifies if the condition for particular action is matched. Action condition is based on the defined queue id (the action is only performed when current queue matches queue id defined in the action configuration) and on the action condition defined in the action configuration. The action condition is based on the value of particular defined datapoint. :param action: action configuration :param payload: see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-data-format :return: result of the action conditions check (True of False) """ current_queue_id = payload["annotation"]["queue"].split("/")[-1] if "queue_ids" in action and ( current_queue_id in action["queue_ids"] or int(current_queue_id) in action["queue_ids"] ): return True if "excluded_queue_ids" in action and ( current_queue_id in action["excluded_queue_ids"] or int(current_queue_id) in action["excluded_queue_ids"] ): return False if "queue_ids" not in action and "excluded_queue_ids" not in action: return True return False def evaluate_action_condition(action: dict, condition_datapoints: dict, index) -> bool: """ Verifies if the condition for particular action is matched. Action condition is based on the defined queue id (the action is only performed when current queue matches queue id defined in the action configuration) and on the action condition defined in the action configuration. The action condition is based on the value of particular defined datapoint. :param action: action configuration :param condition_field_value: datapoint :return: result of the action conditions check (True of False) """ if "action_condition" not in action: return True else: values = [] for cdp in condition_datapoints: cdp = cdp[index] values.append(cdp["content"]["value"]) action_condition = action["action_condition"] for val in values: val = str(val).encode("unicode_escape").decode().encode("unicode_escape").decode() action_condition = re.sub(r"({(.*?)})", "'" + val + "'", action_condition, count=1) if eval(action_condition): return True return False def find_by_schema_id(content: List[dict], schema_id: str) -> List[dict]: """ Return datapoints matching a schema id. :param content: annotation content tree (see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-data) :param schema_id: field's ID as defined in the extraction schema(see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#document-schema) :param accumulator: list for accumulating values with the same schema_id (f.e. values from same table column) :return: the list of datapoints matching the schema ID """ accumulator = [] for node in content: if node["schema_id"] == schema_id: accumulator.append(node) elif "children" in node: accumulator.extend(find_by_schema_id(node["children"], schema_id)) return accumulator def create_message(message_type: str, message_content: str, datapoint_id: str = None) -> dict: """ Create a message which will be shown to the user :param message_type: type of the message, any of {info|warning|error}. Errors prevent confirmation in the UI. :param message_content: message shown to the user :param datapoint_id: id of the datapoint where the message will appear (None for "global" messages). :return: dict with the message definition (see https://api.elis.rossum.ai/docs/#annotation-content-event-response-format) """ return { "content": message_content, "type": message_type, "id": datapoint_id, } def find_by_value(content, value, key="schema_id"): """ Recursively search Rossum datastructure and return found nodes. :param content: annotation or schema content tree :param value: value to look for :param key: in which field to look for the value :return: list of nodes having the value in the key field """ if not isinstance(content, list): return find_by_value([content], value, key) accumulator = [] for node in content: if node[key] == value: accumulator.append(node) elif "children" in node: datapoints = find_by_value(node["children"], value, key) accumulator.extend(datapoints) return accumulator

guide:
How to set up your Find & Replace Values extension:

  1. Specify the queue(s) that the extension is going to be used for.
  2. Set up the actions and transformations.

Read this article if you need help.
description: Automate string manipulations in your documents with powerful find and replace functionalities.
